#summary Building the RDKit code with MinGW.
#labels Development,notes,InProgress

= Downloads =
  * msys
  * mingw
  * bison: http://gnuwin32.sourceforge.net/packages/bison.htm
  * flex: http://gnuwin32.sourceforge.net/packages/flex.htm

= Environment Variables =
  * PATH : must include $RDBASE/lib
  * BOOSTHOME, BOOST_BUILD_PATH : pointing to where the boost sources are installed

= Example Environment =
Here's a sample set of environment variables that I have tested. 

=== Code installation details ===
  * Python install : `n:\Python26`
  * boost install : `n:\boost_1_43_0`
  * RDKit location : `n:\RDKit_win32`
  * mingw location : `n:\mingw`
  * msys location : `n:\msys`

=== Environment variables ===
{{{
export BOOST_ROOT="n:/boost_1_43_0"
export RDBASE="n:\\RDKit_win32"
export PYTHONPATH="n:/RDKit_win32"
}}}

=== Process ===

This may not be optimal, but it works.

From inside the msys shell:
  # `cd $BOOST_ROOT`
  # `bootstrap`
  # `./bjam --toolset=gcc --with-python --with-regex link=shared stage`
  # `cp stage/lib/libboost_python-mgw45-mt-1_43.dll /n/RDKit_win32/lib/`
  # `cd /n/RDKit_win32`
  # `mkdir build`
  # `cd build`
  #  `cmake -G"MSYS Makefiles" -DPYTHON_LIBRARY="n:/python26/libs/libpython26.a" -DPYTHON_INCLUDE_DIR="n:/python26/include" -DBOOST_ROOT="n:/boost_1_43_0" ..`
  # `make install`

As of this writing (15 Dec 2010), this produces a working RDKit build. All the unit tests pass except testMolSupplier; the reasons for this failure are being investigated.
